heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 22 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 10th since records began in 23 September 2024.  The current stretch started on 18 October 2025 and has lasted 6 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (204°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.1°C) and outside temperature (down 2.1°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 110 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 394 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 109.6m lower than yesterday, 81.1m lower than the past week, 393.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 706m to 2390m and averaged 1045.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.2°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
